questions.question: What is the chemical formula of the compound studied under high-pressure conditions?
questions.answer: (C22H12N2O8Zn2)n·X(C2H6O), (C22H12N2O8Zn2)n·X(C3H7NO), (C22H12N2O8Zn2)n·2n(C6H6)

questions.question: At what pressure does the EtOH-included material undergo a phase transition from P4/mmm to C2/m?
questions.answer: 0.69 GPa

questions.question: What is the effect of pressure on the DMF-included material?
questions.answer: It undergoes a guest-mediated phase transition from I4/mcm to P4/mmm at 0.33 GPa via disordering of the DMF guest.

questions.question: Does the benzene-included framework undergo any phase transitions under high pressure?
questions.answer: No, it does not undergo any pressure-induced structural phase transitions.

questions.question: What happens to the EtOH-included material when compressed in a pressure-transmitting medium of Fluorinert® FC-70?
questions.answer: The crystal of the EtOH-included material becomes amorphous at the initial loading pressure of 0.1 GPa.

questions.question: What is the role of EtOH in the structural resilience of the framework under pressure?
questions.answer: Pressure-induced intrusion of EtOH into the framework pores during compression increases the mechanical stability of the material, delaying onset of amorphisation to >2.10 GPa.

questions.question: Is the phase transition in the DMF-included material observed when compressed in a non-penetrating medium?
questions.answer: No, the phase transition is not observed when the DMF-included material is compressed in a non-penetrating medium.

questions.question: What structural change occurs in the EtOH-included material above 0.69 GPa?
questions.answer: The structure changes from a P4/mmm 'square' motif to a C2/m 'rhombus' motif.

questions.question: How does the presence of benzene affect the framework's response to pressure?
questions.answer: The presence of benzene in the pores generates a framework with rhombus-shaped channels and alters the response of the MOF to pressure, causing direct compression of the material.

questions.question: Can the DMF guest molecules be directly modeled in the crystal structure of the DMF-included material under high pressure?
questions.answer: No, the DMF guest molecules become extensively dynamically disordered and cannot be directly modeled in the crystal structure under high pressure.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phase transition observed in the EtOH-included material?
questions.answer: The phase transition is significant because it is mediated by EtOH inclusion at high-pressure, indicating the importance of host–guest interactions.

questions.question: What happens to the unit cell volume of the benzene-included framework under pressure?
questions.answer: The unit cell volume of the benzene-included framework decreases slightly under pressure.

questions.question: Is the phase transition in the DMF-included material reversible?
questions.answer: The text does not provide information on the reversibility of the phase transition in the DMF-included material.

questions.question: What is the effect of guest molecules on the high-pressure phase behavior of flexible MOFs?
questions.answer: The nature and quantity of guest molecules have a large influence on the high-pressure phase behavior of flexible MOFs.

questions.question: What is the role of host–guest interactions in the structural response of MOFs to compression?
questions.answer: Host–guest interactions are crucial in determining the structural response of MOFs to compression, affecting the framework's flexibility and phase transitions.

questions.question: Does the presence of DMF in the framework pores influence the mechanical stability of the material under pressure?
questions.answer: Yes, the presence of DMF in the framework pores appears to impart a degree of mechanical stability to the material, preventing immediate collapse of the framework.

questions.question: What is the impact of pressure on the DMF-included material when compressed in DMF as the pressure-transmitting medium?
questions.answer: When compressed in DMF as the pressure-transmitting medium, the DMF-included material undergoes a phase transition and shows an increase in the calculated pore volume.

questions.question: How does the structure of the EtOH-included material change under high pressure?
questions.answer: Under high pressure, the structure of the EtOH-included material changes from a square motif to a more voluminous phase with rhombus-shaped pores.

questions.question: What triggers the phase transition in the EtOH-included material?
questions.answer: The phase transition in the EtOH-included material is triggered by the 'super-filling' of the channels with EtOH from the pressure-transmitting medium.

questions.question: Is the phase transition observed in the DMF-included material driven by direct compression?
questions.answer: No, the phase transition observed in the DMF-included material is not driven by direct compression but by pressure-induced intrusion of the DMF medium into the framework channels.
